intro: Argemone pleiacantha subsp. pinnatisecta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved prickly poppy, is a flowering plant native to parts of Mexico and Central America. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and distinctive pinnatisect leaves that give it a feathery appearance. The plant produces bright orange to yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open areas. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
